title: How to Make Fake Rings Under Your Eyes

steps.title: Get a black marker; preferably washable.
steps.content: Get a black marker; preferably washable.

steps.title: Draw a rather large smudge on one of your fingers.
steps.content: Draw a rather large smudge on one of your fingers. Make it big, but not very thick.

steps.title: Take another finger on the opposite hand.
steps.content: Take another finger on the opposite hand. Rub that on your smudged finger.

steps.title: Apply the marker to below your eyes carefully.
steps.content: Apply the marker to below your eyes carefully. Start at the inside corners of your eyes and work the mark down and out slightly.

steps.title: Add a much lighter bit.
steps.content: Add a much lighter bit. Start from the outside edge down toward the first mark if you want a more extreme effect, or for darker lighting.

steps.title: Put some on your finger, and rub it in lightly.
steps.content: Put some on your finger, and rub it in lightly.

steps.title: Do this again, so it is layered.
steps.content: Do this again, so it is layered. Also try to get the bit closest to the eye darker.

steps.title: Scribble with some black/dark brown eyeliner on your finger.
steps.content: Scribble with some black/dark brown eyeliner on your finger. [1] X Research source Prep your skin with primer or light moisturizer before applying the makeup for the most natural-looking results.

steps.title: Smudge it under your eyes, darker towards the bridge of your nose.
steps.content: Smudge it under your eyes, darker towards the bridge of your nose.

steps.title: Add purple or blue lightly over it.
steps.content: Add purple or blue lightly over it. This will make it look more bruised (if you want that look). [2] X Research source
